entry.title: Sam Bankman-Fried Files Request to Keep Hold of $450M in Robinhood Stock
entry.summary: The United States Department of Justice recently seized the FTX founder's stake in the popular trading app.

entry.title: Crypto Exchange Huobi to Lay off 20% of Staff: Report
entry.summary: The layoffs would see Huobi join crypto exchanges including Coinbase, Crypto.com and Kraken in making sweeping cuts to staff numbers.

entry.title: Developers Burn 5 Trillion BONK as Solana-Based Meme Coin Slides
entry.summary: The downturn continues for the Doge-themed Solana-based meme coin BONK, despite the team’s massive token burn.

entry.title: HTC's New Mixed Reality Headset Is 'Gateway' to Metaverse: CES 2023
entry.summary: The HTC Vive XR Elite will compete with the Meta Quest Pro headset, while HTC's metaverse push includes a partnership with layer-1 blockchain Lamina1.

entry.title: DCG Confirms Shutdown of Wealth Management Subsidiary HQ
entry.summary: The news comes the same day as another DCG subsidiary, crypto broker Genesis, announced a massive wave of layoffs.

entry.title: DOJ Files Charges Against Alleged Mutant Ape Planet NFT Rug Pull
entry.summary: Authorities arrested the collection’s founder, Aurelien Michel, at JFK airport on Wednesday evening.

entry.title: Chinese Researchers Claim They Cracked Encryption with Quantum Computers
entry.summary: Skeptical technology experts believe the declaration is a hoax intended to cause panic.

entry.title: 3AC Founders Kyle Davies and Su Zhu Tagged in Tweet Delivering Court Subpoena
entry.summary: After keeping a relatively low profile, the collapse of FTX brought the Three Arrows Capital cofounders back into the public eye.

entry.title: Solana’s Doge-Themed BONK Drops 54% After Bonkers 3,300% Gains
entry.summary: BONK is still massively outperforming other coins this week, fueling Solana’s own price surge despite the meme coin’s volatility.

entry.title: Genesis Cuts Staff by 30% as Financial Woes From FTX Fallout Persist
entry.summary: Crypto lending firm Genesis is laying off staff in an effort to reduce costs and stabilize its troubled financial situation.

entry.title: New York Attorney General Sues Ex-Celsius Boss Alex Mashinksy for Fraud
entry.summary: Mashinsky allegedly duped hundreds of thousands of investors out of billions of dollars of cryptocurrency.

entry.title: Shopify Merchants Can Now Sell Avalanche NFTs Through Their Online Stores
entry.summary: Venly’s Avalanche app is now available to all Shopify merchants, letting them mint and sell NFTs through a no-code interface.

entry.title: Silvergate Stock Down 40% Following Diem Write-Off, Job Cuts
entry.summary: The collapse of FTX caused a spike in withdrawals from the crypto bank, while deposits dropped to just $3.8 billion in the last quarter.

entry.title: LG Doubles Down on Smart TV Metaverse Push at CES 2023
entry.summary: The Korean tech giant made a plethora of announcements relating to its metaverse ambitions at the 2023 Consumer Electronics Show.

entry.title: U.S. Judge Issues Detention Order for Mango Markets Attacker
entry.summary: Avraham Eisenberg has been deemed a serious flight risk due to his background and potentially tens of millions in secret wealth.

entry.title: Animoca Slashes Target For Metaverse Fund to $1 Billion: ‘It Could Be Less’
entry.summary: The chairman of Animoca Brands had previously suggested that its metaverse fund raise could reach as much as $2 billion.

entry.title: CoinDeal Scammers Nailed By SEC in $45 Million Fraud Case
entry.summary: The Commission has charged the defendants with wire fraud, selling unregistered securities, and using investor funds to finance a lavish lifestyle.

entry.title: Regulators Seize Millions in Robinhood Shares from FTX
entry.summary: Sought by FTX creditors and BlockFi, shares held by the collapsed firm have now been confiscated.

entry.title: NFT Sales in 2022 Nearly Matched the 2021 Boom, Despite Market Crash
entry.summary: The NFT market is down bad, but thanks to a red-hot start, the year ended almost on par with 2021.

entry.title: Why Bitcoin Supporters Organized a 'Bank Run' on Crypto Exchanges
entry.summary: A grassroots movement is calling on Bitcoin users to take their coins off of exchanges and out of the control of third parties.

entry.title: Judge Rules Celsius Earn Account Funds Belong to Estate, Not Users
entry.summary: The bankruptcy court also says Celsius can sell stablecoins in Earn accounts to fund administrative expenses.

entry.title: Sports Giant Fanatics Sells Off Its Majority Stake in NFT Startup Candy Digital
entry.summary: Fanatics has sold its 60% share in Candy Digital to a group of investors led by Galaxy Digital, CEO Michael Rubin told staff.

entry.title: Institutional Crypto Investments Dropped 95% to $433 Million in 2022
entry.summary: It's the lowest annual deposits seen since 2018, a 95% decrease from 2021, according to CoinShares.

entry.title: Bitcoin Buckles, Bounces as Fed Signals More Aggressive Rate Hikes to Come
entry.summary: Bitcoin dipped sharply with stocks before regaining ground following news that Fed has no plans to ease up.

entry.title: 'See You in Court': Logan Paul Threatens to Sue YouTuber Coffeezilla Over CryptoZoo Scam Claims
entry.summary: In response to Coffeezilla’s video series, Paul denies scamming his audience and said he has only lost money on his NFT game.

entry.title: Genesis CEO Asks for More Time as Winklevoss Pressures Parent Company DCG
entry.summary: Genesis believes it “can arrive at a solution” to its current financial pickle.

entry.title: Fake Solana NFTs Are Being Sold on Magic Eden in 'Massive' Exploit
entry.summary: Magic Eden said that the situation was resolved, but creators and traders claim that fraudulent NFT sales are still happening.

entry.title: Coinbase Stock Price Jumps 12% Following $100M NYDSF Settlement
entry.summary: The settlement means the end of the New York regulator’s probe, which Coinbase first disclosed in 2021.

entry.title: Walking the Red Carpet at The Crypties 2022
entry.summary: Sander on the Street is back! Decrypt's Sander Lutz walked the red carpet and accosted attendees as they arrived at the inaugural Crypties awards gala in December 2022 at Art Basel in Miami, presented by Decrypt Studios.

entry.title: Coinbase Reaches $100 Million Settlement with New York Regulator Over Compliance Programs
entry.summary: The crypto exchange will pay a $50 million fine and invest $50 million into bolstering its compliance programs.

entry.title: UK National Crime Agency to Launch Specialized Crypto Team
entry.summary: The formation of the National Cyber Crime Unit Crypto Cell will “signal an increased focus” on policing crypto assets.

entry.title: Wyre 'Scaling Back' Operations Amid Crypto Winter: CEO
entry.summary: The payments company’s CEO Ioannis Giannaros downplayed claims that it plans to shutter operations this month.

entry.title: SDNY Launches FTX Task Force To Investigate and Recover Victim Funds
entry.summary: The task force will use asset forfeiture to recover billions of dollars’ worth of funds owed to victims of the exchange’s collapse.

entry.title: Bitcoin Mining Firm Riot Ditches 'Blockchain' From Name in Rebrand
entry.summary: The company will rebrand as Riot Platforms, as it diversifies amid a bleak outlook for the wider Bitcoin mining industry.

entry.title: Bitcoin Miner Core Scientific Reaches Agreement To Shut Off Celsius Mining Rigs
entry.summary: The two bankrupt businesses will end the hosting agreement which Core Scientific said was costing it $53,000 a day.

entry.title: Why NFTs on Magic Eden Are Unintentionally Displaying Porn, 'Big Bang Theory' Images
entry.summary: The top Solana marketplace says there's no need to panic, and it has not been hacked.

entry.title: Judge Prohibits Sam Bankman-Fried From Accessing FTX, Alameda Funds
entry.summary: The change to Bankman-Fried’s bond agreement follows transfers associated with Alameda Research that took place last week.

entry.title: Nike’s RTFKT COO Loses His NFTs in Massive 'Hack'
entry.summary: Nikhil Gopalani said he was hacked by a “clever phisher” who poached his NFT collection.

entry.title: White House Claims Meetings Between SBF and Senior Biden Officials Were About Pandemic
entry.summary: Press Secretary Karine Jean-Pierre conceded the four meetings may have also covered “general information” about crypto.

entry.title: Crypto Crystal Ball: Biggest Trends to Watch in 2023
entry.summary: Poised to deliver clarity on post-FTX fallout and major legal and regulatory questions, 2023 is already shaping up to be a critical year for the crypto industry.

entry.title: U.S. Regulators Warn Banks That Crypto Is Not 'Safe and Sound'
entry.summary: The FDIC, Federal Reserve, and the Office of the Comptroller of the Currency collaborated on the declaration.

entry.title: The Crypties 2022: Highlight Reel
entry.summary: In December 2022 at Art Basel in Miami, Decrypt Studios held the inaugural Crypties awards gala. With emcee Josh Ostrovsky ("The Fat Jewish") and presenters from a range of crypto projects, statuettes were awarded in nine categories. The evening was sponsored by Polygon, Filecoin Foundation, Lamina1, Async, BeetsDAO, The Gold Mask, Gem Set, Breakout, Anonymous, Infinite Objects, Ape Water, Decentralized Pictures, and Vault 721.

entry.title: gm: Zora Looks Beyond NFTs to DAO Creation
entry.summary: Zora sees itself as more than just an NFT marketplace; its next era is about helping people easily launch a DAO. Zora Co-founder Jacob Horne joined Dan Roberts and Andrew Hayward to talk competition, the NFT speculative boom and bust, how Zora and Nouns are connected, and why Zora thinks DAOs are the future. Watch Episode 27 of the gm podcast and make sure to subscribe on Apple or Spotify.

entry.title: How Tezos Was Ahead of the Proof-of-Stake Merge: Web Summit 2022
entry.summary: Tezos co-founder Kathleen Breitman talks about how the Tezos blockchain has used a proof-of-stake mechanism since its inception, her admiration for Tendermint, Ethereum and sharding, progressive decentralization, and NFT gaming with Decrypt's Stephen Graves onstage at Web Summit in Lisbon.

entry.title: gm: SEC Commissioner Hester Peirce Critiques SEC's Approach to Crypto
entry.summary: SEC Commissioner Hester Peirce has been an outspoken advocate for crypto and a candid critic of her own agency’s approach to regulating crypto markets. In an extensive chat with Dan Roberts and Stacy Elliott she discussed FTX, Gary Gensler, DeFi, and the problems with the Howey Test. Don’t miss this conversation for the inside take on the SEC’s thinking on crypto—straight from the source. Watch Episode 25 of the gm podcast and make sure to subscribe on Apple or Spotify.

entry.title: gm: Tezos Co-Founder Kathleen Breitman Sounds Off on FTX Collapse
entry.summary: Tezos co-founder Kathleen Breitman has been in crypto since the beginning and has seen a lot of cycles and failures. She joined Stacy Elliott and Dan Roberts and brought the fire on FTX and Sam Bankman-Fried’s mismanagement, “decentralization theater,” Tezos’s reputation and positioning, crypto sports marketing, and NFTs. Watch Episode 25 of the gm podcast and make sure to subscribe on Apple or Spotify.

entry.title: Raising in a Bear Market: Slow Ventures, Volt Capital, Conviction, AngelBlock at 0xpo Summit
entry.summary: Clay Robbins of Slow Ventures, Soona Amhaz of Volt Capital, Sarah Guo of Conviction and formerly Greylock, and Alex Strzesniewski of AngelBlock joined Decrypt's Jason Nelson at 0xpo Summit in San Francisco on November 3 for an extensive panel on raising venture money even during Crypto Winter.
